titlestmt.titleproper: Partial Inventory of the Craig W. H. Luther papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff and Rachel Yamada

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-05-17T09:39-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Revised after circulation of finding aid and to add note about 2017 incremental materials by Sarah Patton.
Revised to add incremental materials description by Rachel Yamada.

did.abstract: Memoirs, diaries, questionnaire responses and interview summaries of military veterans, notes, photocopies of military records, printed matter, and photographs relating to German military operations during World War II, mainly on the Eastern Front. Used as research material for the books by Craig W. H. Luther, Blood and Honor: The History of the 12th SS Panzer Division "Hitler Youth, " 1943-1945 (San Jose, 1988), and Barbarossa Unleashed: The German Blitzkrieg through Central Russia to the Gates of Moscow, June-December 1941 (Atglen, Pa., 2013).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Craig W. H. Luther papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1988, with increments received in 2014, 2015, and 2017.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Craig W. H. Luther papers include questionnaire responses and letters by veterans of the German 12th SS-Panzerdivision "Hitlerjugend" and by veterans of Canadian, British, and Polish military units who fought against the 12th SS-Panzerdivision, as well as summaries of interviews with these veterans. These materials relate to activities of the 12th SS-Panzerdivision in World War II, and especially during the 1944 Normandy campaign. Used as research material for Luther's book, Blood and Honor: The History of the 12th SS Panzer Division "Hitler Youth," 1943-1945 (San Jose, 1988).

An increment received in 2015 consists of research materials, soldier questionnaires, memoirs, and other materials relating to Luther's Strategic Withdrawal of German Army Groups South and Center to the Dnepr River and First Soviet Attempts to Capture Kiev, August-October 1943, as well as Barbarossa Unleashed: The German Blitzkrieg through Central Russia to the Gates of Moscow, June-December 1941.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Research materials, soldier questionnaires, memoirs, and materials relating to Craig Luther's Strategic Withdrawal of German Army Groups South and Center to the Dnepr River and First Soviet Attempts to Capture Kiev, August-October 1943, as well as Barbarossa Unleashed: The German Blitzkrieg through Central Russia to the Gates of Moscow, June-December 1941.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials referenced in Luther's Strategic Withdrawal of German Army Groups South and Center to the Dnepr River and First Soviet Attempts to Capture Kiev, August-October 1943.

scopecontent.p: Includes Standing Fast: German Defensive Doctrine on the Russian Front During World War II by Major Timothy A. Wray and The Anvil of War by Generaloberst Erhard Rauss and Generalluetnant Oldwig Von Natzmer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Generalfeldmarschall Walter Model : Legende und Wirklichkeit. Materials in German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes The Russo-German War, July 1943-May 1945, Defense Against Russian Breakthroughs edited by W. Victor Madej, When the Titans Clashed: How the Red Army Stopped Hitler, The Battle of Kursk by David M. Glantz, and various articles.
